file_content.text: You can put aside your weapons. I won't try to run.
I can walk, but it's difficult. I need you to be patient.
Besides, I doubt I'd make it to an escape pod without my intestines spilling out.
I take it you're the general. Grand Moff Kilran sent me to find you.
You who I'm looking for?
Kilran did? Of course. He would have the gall to send a transport to take on a warship--and succeed.
How did you get injured?
Are you hurt?
Unlucky--caught in your ship's attack. I'm told the wounds aren't fatal, but that doesn't help the pain.
I might just spill your intestines myself. I don't need you alive.
I could kill you.
I'm well aware of Imperial policy regarding my kind.
I was a general in the Imperial military service.
Did they tell you that when they sent you here? Did they even know?
Why would you betray the Empire?
Why?
You were a servant of the Sith Empire. You should have been honored to obey.
You served the Sith.
Ah, military men. So sad and fickle--the Force is weak in your blood.
You're a simpleton.
You were willing to sell out your people to the Republic.
That's traitorous.
I hope the Republic's paying you awfully well for this.
You're selling out.
Believe whatever you want. It doesn't change your fate.
I don't care.
If you knew what I knew, you'd understand. If you'd heard what both sides are plotting, you wouldn't be eager to restart this war.
They're building doomsday weapons. Shields that envelop planets; missiles that darken suns. Republic and Empire are planning to raze worlds--annihilate civilizations.
It will be unlike anything the galaxy's seen since the Great Hyperspace War. And it's too late to stop it--the so-called peace is already lost.
If that's true, why defect to the Republic?
Then why bother?
There's no place for me in the Empire anymore. I thought my last act might be to even the odds--create a stalemate.
It doesn't seem to matter anymore.
There'll be bloodshed on a massive scale--and I will be part of it.
It will be glorious.
At the start, yes. But you won't survive. None of us will.
I've heard enough of this.
We're done.
Yes. I shouldn't expect you'd care.
You have me, then. Me, my stomach full of blood and my implant full of cybernetic secrets and stolen plans. What will you do?
I'm going to bring you to my ship. From there, you'll be transported to Dromund Kaas and taken into Imperial custody.
You're my prisoner.
Where I'll be tortured or executed, or--at best--placed in a cell for the rest of my life.
Still, there's nowhere in the galaxy where I could truly hide. I will follow you.
You're no use to me alive.
I'll kill you.
So be it. We're all as good as dead, anyway.
You won't take me. You can't.
